name: More Balanced Blood and Faith? (Cleric 28 / Bard 2 / RDD 10)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
More Balanced Blood and Faith ?

Cleric / Bard / RDD is a very powerful class combination

I've had a look at Mithdradates's Blood and Faith again, written in 2006
He was very clear on what he felt the weaknesses were:
- average HP
- average fort save
- average will save
- poor reflex save

In many ways how clear he was made my life much easier as to how the build could be improved upon

I increased the HP by 80 in this build to a very respectable 480 (720 capped) by increasing Con by 2 at the cost of 2 strength and 1 wisdom (I delay lvl 9 spells to level 23)
I also increased the Fort save by 6 to a very respectable 31 (40) by swapping Epic Prowess for Epic Fortitude. It provides extra protection against implosion, petrify, devastating critical, and other nasties if your death ward gets stripped by Mords.
The Will save I left alone as the build has undispellable extended clarity available as well as UMD.
The reflex save I took Epic Reflexes to buff it to 19 (28) [edited]

It cost me 2 Str to make these changes which I was fine with, as the build ends on an even Str modifier (34)
The Base AB was 40, which is great for a cleric who can boost it to 66 pretty easily. I was unsure whether that 1 AB from Epic Prowess would have made the build more powerful compared to extra fortitude saves apart from the awesome wow factor. If the buffs get dispelled by Mords (or other dispels early game) he is a low warrior, but if they remain, he is a monster.
edit: chose to go Morning Star for extra AC and another pre-epic feat, although one can always switch a spear if desired for extra damage
I also took ESF: Concentration for Word of Faith / Harm during melee combat 

Feats wise I put Silent Spell and Craft Wand instead of Improved Critical and Improved Knockdown. I felt they gave the build more.
Took domains of War [Cat's, Aura of Vitality] and Trickery [Improved Invisibility] (Erythnul)

Skills wise I put discipline to 40, maxed concentration, near max spellcraft, tumble 40, UMD 33 modified. Spot is only 12(16) but I am hoping True Seeing and items such as a Watchman's Helm can help with detecting sneakers.

I did consider a dwarf version but it lost a lot of skill points so I abandoned that idea.
I also considered an EDR III version, however because RDD is obtained late, EDR III is ideally obtained late which is also not ideal either.

Other cool stuff might have been ESF: Concentration for lots of harms with the great AB, also Empower Spell, and some ranks in Taunt of course to lower AC to hit them more. Sadly cleric has awful skill points / level.

Anyway I have posted this one up for your review and commentary

Very much a learning process for me

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
I think I will drop Martial Weapon Proficiency and change the weapon focus to Morning Star, which is a good weapon, also has dual types of damage (piercing/bludgeoning) and very much fits thematically with Erythnul. Spear is good too (it has a great x3 crit and gets 1.5 str bonus) as a back up weapon.

This frees up a feat which can be used to take Great Fortitude (to boost the Fort save up further to 32[41]), allowing this guy to manfight with all that HP a lot better now with a Tower Shield. The more I play, the more I value the Fort save, and this guy will have 8 more fort save than the original 24[33] in addition to the 80 extra HP if I make this change. Mostly to deal with implosions and dev crits but death magic too if death ward gets stripped. 

I like builds with decent (but not over the top) HP and fort saves, it allows the character to 'get in the face' of the enemy much more effectively

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
This isn't really what I consider a balanced Cler/RDD, it still focuses on maxing AB but opts for higher HP. To make this a balanced Cler/RDD I suggest lowering the AB in order to improve the other aspects of the build. In low/medium magic worlds the self-buffed AB is already on par with a minmaxed WM, decreasing AB slightly would still result in a build with decent AB.

Changing the level layout to Cler26/Bard4/RDD10 lets you have a pre-epic spread of either Cler12/Bard2/RDD6 (best for 40) or Cler18/Bard2 (best for smooth levelling). Cler12/Bard2/RDD6 gives +1 Fort, +3 Ref, and +4 Will at the cost of -1 AB compared to Cler20. It also means you can reach RDD9 at level 23 for more skill points.

I would change the starting stats to 14STR/10DEX in order to end on even STR and WIS scores. I wouldn't bother increasing CON by 2, 16 CON and Toughness already gives you 480 HP (476 with Cler26/Bard4/RDD10).

I agree with switching to morningstar over halberd, I suggest using the extra feat for either Expertise or Lightning Reflexes. Swapping 4 Great STR feats for Epic Prowess, Epic Reflexes, ESF: Conc and ESF: Disc would make the character much more balanced at the cost of 1 AB and 2 damage. If Discipline isn't important on WoG then stick with the starting stats of 15TR/8DEX and swap ESF: Disc for another Great STR.
Personally I only use ability feats if I'm minmaxing, aiming for a particular ability score, or if I have spare feats. Why bother with +1 STR when you could have +4 to saves or +10 to skills?

Naked Stats [Comparison to your build]:
AB: 24 (BAB) + 10 (STR) + 4 (Feats) = +38 [-2]
AC: 10 (Base) + 8 (Tumble) + 2 (Feats) + 4 (RDD Bonus) + 8 (Armor) + 3 (Shield) = 35 [+1, no difference after buffs]
HP: 316 (Base) + 120 (CON) + 40 (Feats) = 476 [-44]
Fortitude: 23 (Base) + 3 (CON) + 4 (Feats) = 30 [0]
Reflex: 19 (Base) + 4 (Feats) = 23 (25 with Lightning Reflexes) [+8/+10]
Will: 26 (Base) + 5 (WIS) = 31 [+5]
Concentration: 43 (Base) + 3 (CON) + 10 (Feats) = 56 [+9]
Discipline: 43 (Base) + 10 (STR) + 10 (Feats) = 63 [+11, would be +8 if your build was optimised for 40]

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Yunim for your suggestions

You have made some excellent suggestions that I like. 
I can see in that whilst my build might be more balanced than the original, there could be more balancing to do.
I like the idea of dropping the two Con increases for Str gains, and get two Epic General feats as a result.
One could be Epic Reflexes, the other could be ESF: Concentration for casting in close melee combat spells such as Word of Faith and Harm.
As to altering the pre-leveling layout I hesitate to drop the BAB 25, going cleric heavy early makes the build more playable throughout its lifespan, and the extra BAB is good to have if one is Morded with only 26-28 CLs. Cleric has so many powerful features that it can live without UMD and Tumble dumps for quite some time.

One other thing, I did mention in the title my goal is 'More balanced' Blood and Faith, not a 'Balanced Cleric RDD'
I think a Str goal of 34 retains the Cleric /RDD High AB High Str identity of the build
Diluting it further loses one of the special high Str elements brings RDD to builds, a very focused fighter could hit 34 for example, diluting it down to 30 makes it lose what makes it special 

Great discussion btw, I dont think there has been much discussion about Cleric / RDDs for a while

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content: Your changes, Orion, lean more towards my own preferences.  Craft Wand, Silent Spell.  I would drop either Toughness or Great Fort for IKD.  As a Domain junkie, I would probably go for Travel & Trickery over war.  I would also pump Wisdom right away and then go for Strength, relying instead on Bulls and Divine Power for Strength increases until you reached your Strength-era increases.
